column4: hello, can someone help me with my ubuntu installation that went horribly wrong?
what seems to be the problem?
upon pressing the reset button, does it do it again?
then for some reason your GRUB is unable to load, you could try installing it again. Search for GRUB disc, or pop in the live CD. This might work, but i wouldnt know for sure...
so its working? good stuff, good luck on your quest ;)
actually, I am totally new at linux and I don't know what to do with the grub prompt
GRUB is basically where you choose which OS you want to boot. Should have your Gutsy on top, and Windows (if installed) below...
no, you should have the option of just hitting 'enter'... but there appears to be something wrong with it if this isn't the case
try a reboot, again... see if it works...
I got the grub boot screen and clicked the ubuntu startup - Looks good so far, but I'm not sure how stable this is...
If it's a GRUB problem I'm dealing with, can I repair GRUB somehow while I'm in Ubuntu perhaps?
Actually i don't think so...
GRUB is only there for those who want to use multiple OSÃƒ's
Could this be the result of a faulty install or bad ISO?  Should I try to burn another ISO and try to reinstall Gutsy over the other Gutsy install maybe?
If you want, you can... there should, however, be the option of just re-installing the GRUB
Ok, thanks a lot for your thoughts and ideas...I'll play around with it and see if I can get it going again (I'm dual booting Gutsy and Windows 2000 SP4).
Sounds like a hardware issue... could be fixed with the good ol' reset ;)
is your X server failing or what?
I can't boot from a gutsy live cd.  After the boot screen, all I get are I/O errors
by bootscreen you mean grub? or the ubuntu login screen?
sounds bad! i don't think i know how to help, sorry
